ratings.comment: HE IS AWESOME!!! I took his chem 343 and wanted to wait until he teaches chem 345. Unfortunately he's not teaching at uw anymore...So sad.. Notes are very helpful. exam are fair. you will get an A if you put into effort.

Dr. Clauss is the best professor I have ever had at UW Madison. He's very approachable and truly knows how to teach Organic Chem. He really put a lot into his teaching (which you don't often see at a place like UW-Madison). He instilled in me a love of o-chem which has not left me since taking his class. A truly remarkable man.
He is one of the few professors I felt comfortable asking questions to.  He is very passionate in what he teaches and truly cares about his students. So far he is my favorite professor.
Engaging and enthusiastic.  Available for office hours and willing to answer questions.  Tests are fair.  He is my favorite professor that I've had.
This guy is a great professor! One of the best I have had. His lectures are so helpful and he makes chem fun. His nerdy jokes are great! Strongly recommend him for any class.
He is just an amazing professior!!!  I love his lecture so much. Highly suggest!
I had almost zero interest in chemistry and was only taking this class as a requisite for my bio major, but b/c of this man I may end up switching to an ochem major. He's that good
Love this guy. Awesome professor!  I was scared going into o-chem but he made this class soooo much better. Best Prof I have had so far.

If you are taking Chem 343, take Prof. Clauss.  He is by far the best O-Chem professor on campus.  O-Chem will be tough no matter what, but his tests are fair and his curve is very generous.  Advice: his tests really focus on what he covered in lecture!

i took him for both ochem 343 and 345. he's definitely the best ochem professor at uw madison. it's best if you go to all of his lectures and review his lectures frequently. exams are not very difficult if you learn stuff from his lectures, text book was hardly necessary for me. really, take him. he's the best.
Kept the class interesting.  Exams are difficult (similar to quizzes).  But the class is curved.

Very good organic chemistry professor.  He obviously enjoys the subject and wants his students to enjoy it too.  He holds regular review sessions which are optional.  He helped make a challenging subject more accessible.
Amazing man.  Simply amazing.  One of the greatest professors I've ever had.  Do the work and you will be rewarded :)
Hands down the best professor I have ever had.

Professor Clauss is the best ochem professor at UW madison. Clearly loves what he's doing. I'm so glad I got him because I hate organic chemistry and have always struggled with it, but not this year. He's always willing to help and the way he teaches, makes things very clear. TAKE HIM!

Clauss is the best O.Chem professor at UW-Madison..and I've had others! Very friendly and, unlike all others, he really wants you to learn it. Loves his subject and has a great sense of humor. O.chem is tough no matter what, but with Clauss it's a lot less painful. Highly recommend.
BEST PROF I'VE EVER HAD!!! This is how ochem should be taught. Always makes himself available for help. Great guy! Take him!

Dr. Clauss is the best professor I've ever had. He definitely makes sure his students understand what he is talking about. He uses examples from the textbook and gives assigned practice problems. Very helpful...great professor!
Makes Organic Chemistry Funny

Awesome teacher with a great sense of humor.  With Clauss, you have to do the work but if you put in the extra time to go to office hours, you can be sure that you will get clarity on any complex topic inneffectively covered in the text.

Ochem is hard no matter what. But Clauss actually made it kinda fun! Hes super friendly, extremely helpful outside of class.  Lectures are well structured and he explains everything very well.  Best Prof I've ever had!

honestly one of the best teachers I've had in my lifetime. not only is he a great guy that beyond loves O-Chem, but he truly cares about the students. he offers a huge number of options to study for quizzes and exams (book problems, online problems [you must buy], and practice quizzes and exams). I would take another class with him in a heartbeat

Best o.chem professor at UW by far- he actually almost made me like o.chem. He covers everything you need to know for the MCAT (it's your job to remember it, not his to remind you what you need to know). I would definitely recommend going to his office hours if you're unclear on anything. Also he writes great letters of recommendation.
I LOVE CLAUSS! Chemistry could not get any better.

He is a GREAT professor. Lots of fun. Unfortunately, his scantron quizzes do not prepare you for the exams in which you need to write things out. There are also some subjects he grazes over or teaches differently that become more important in Chem345.(Cleaving ethers, rearrangement of cations) They are easily picked up though.

God bless this man! Best professor I have had at UW. Genuinely cares about his students. Makes lecture fun. The material is tough, but Clauss has a way of making it bearable. TAKE HIM over anybody else. I waited a semester to start Ochem so I could take him--SO GLAD I did. Clauss is the best.

Any negative commentators here have no idea what they're doing. If you scored low on the MCATs that's because you didn't study enough. He is clear and vibrant and makes the subject interesting (we're still talking O Chem here). Work hard and you will get your A and more than ample understanding of the subject

I ended up getting an A in the class because he's a great professor and he teaches clearly. Unfortunately, it did not prepare me for the MCATs. His expectations are lower than other O Chem teachers and that's why everyone enrolls in his class. I say enroll if you want a good professor and want the A, but don't if you want to do well on the MCATs.

Best professor I've had, everything he covers in lecture is whats on the test, go to lecture, take notes, and do GREAT! he explains ochem so well! Do his practice exams they are pretty mcuh exactly the same as the exams..TAKE HIM!

Clauss is amazing. He's funny, & makes ochem very clear and understandable. I used to hate chemistry in all forms until I had him. He definitely makes an effort to connect with his students. Practice materials that he provides are very helpful for tests.
Amazing. I've never had such a great professor. He makes it easy and is so easy to approach. He actually cares a lot about his students and teaches very well.
Best Ochem professor ever
I have a giant mancrush on this guy after a semester of chem

Hands down the best professor I've had at UW so far. His lectures are crystal clear and easy to follow, and his individual help and question answering is second to none! He is one of the nicest professors I've met on campus, and genuinely cares about all  his students and their understanding. Take him and be ready to actually learn and enjoy ochem!

Clauss is the BOMB! You absolutely must attend lecture because the book won't do you squat. That being said, you won't even need to touch the book if you attend. He has legible handwriting, only gives you the info you need, his lectures are funny and he's a fair grader. Great curve. Difficult class, but for someone who hates chem you can't go wrong

Clauss is awesome and really enjoys teaching organic chemistry. While this subject is hard for everyone his jokes lighten the mood. He is really easy to meet with for extra help otherwise TA's are extremely helpful during their office hours. Good luck and do the problem sets!!
Clauss is an AMAZING professor. Made ochem bearable. Exams are very fair and he presents the material well. If possible, TAKE CLAUSS. Best professor ever!

Clauss is awesome! He really cares about the subject matter, almost as much as he cares about his students doing well. Go talk to him if you ever have any questions, and he will take the time to help you understand.

I love Dr Clauss! Very enthusiastic about what he does and it really comes through. His exams are tough, but if you go to class and do the problem sets you should be fine. Great lecturer, and always made himself available, and promptly responds to emails. Best professor I've ever had.

best professor i have ever had! Lectures are super clear and he is always willing to help out. He is really interested in helping students succeed. Quizzes and tests are difficult because he really pushes you to learn the material beyond just regurgitating basic information. TAKE HIM!!

Clauss is the man. If you're taking OChem, take it with him. His tests/quizzes were a little tricky, but he curves very generously. Also, was very available to answer questions and help students out, wanted you to do well. Has good stories about industrial chemistry as well.

If you need O-chem and Clauss is an option, take him. Rearrange your schedule if necessary.  He's a terrific teacher, actually makes O-chem fun, and everything you need to know comes from the lectures (I did better once I gave up reading the text). Tests are tough, but curve is beyond generous. Best teacher at UW!

Prof. Clauss is a very good educator.  He explains concepts very well and his office hours are extremely helpful.  He posts practice problems and answer keys weekly, so you know what type of problems to expect.  However, the exams and quizzes are very difficult, you really have to know your stuff (no partial credit).  You have to work hard.
The most amazing, adorable guy in the world. He explains everything very well, and you can tell that he is passionate about what he teaches.
Take him hes amazing
Dr. Clauss = crystal clear lectures + great man + ingenious educator + Ridiculously generous curves. Period.
This guy is an AWESOME teacher.  He doesn't ask you to break your back studying or memorize the entire book.  Just make sure you do the practice problems and you will be fine.
One of my favorite profs here. He was there for any kind of help you needed and his lectures were very easy to follow. I highly recommend him.

Amazing Professor, Definitely one of the best I've had at the University. He explains all the material in lectures, and does NOT test material NOT covered in lecture. Exams are hard, but curves are generous. Quiz curves are VERY generous, had a few where a 3/20 was a D.
Nice guy and a good prof - probably one of the best to take for o chem since his exams are pretty fair and he tests more for understanding and less for memorization. Lectures are VERY worth going to.
Awesome teacher! Take chemistry with him if you can!

Great Teacher. Clauss made the class very interesting. I actually ENJOY organic chemistry. It wasn't too hard to get an A. I averaged a 90 on all of the midterms. Just do the practice exams and problems. There are no surprises. Great Class!

He's funny and things we need to know are clearly gone over in lecture. There are no surprises. If you do and understand the practice exams you are pretty well off. If you have to take ochem, I can't imagine a better professor.

Great teacher!  Very clear in lecture.  Practice exams are extremely helpful and representative.  Tests are hard but very fair to those who know the material.  Actually made Organic Chemistry a class I came to like.  To my knowledge, the best O-Chem professor here.
Prof Clauss is an awesome teacher! Definitely made Ochem a lot easier. His practice exams were representative of the midterms, so as long as you work on them, you should be fine.
Awesome professor.  O-chem is tough but unlike many professors, Clauss acknowledges that.  Very clear and easy to understand, fair exams and great sense of humor.  Strongly recommended!

Amazing teacher. Very clear, funny, kind, and helpful. He def has the students' best interests at heart. Asking questions in class is welcomed, he never makes you feel embarrassed. He also allows for extra office hours & apts. if necessary/requested. I'd DEFINTELY recommend him. I'm a B student, but he made it so interesting I ended up with an A.
Very good professor.  Good lecturer, tries to make everything as clear as possible and very fair when it comes to grading.  It's still a hard class, but this is a great professor to take it with.

He obviously enjoys teaching and he seemed to really care whether the students were understanding the material. He doesn't make impossible exams and the lectures are usually interesting (as much as chem can be).
